sentences.text:
but I believe it shouldn't rely on the return value from ad-do-it, but
instead look at ad-return-value.

I think it only goes wrong if there's other `around' defadvice on the
func in question.

For a solitary advice the ad-do-it is a direct call
to the function, but when that's not so I think you get the return from
other advice, and that advice isn't obliged to return anything in
particular.
Perhaps something like the following, untested, also a simplification
and make corresponding changes to the ad-enable-advice /
Versions of packages emacs-goodies-el depends on:

ii  bash                      3.2-5          The GNU Bourne Again SHell
ii  dpkg                      1.15.3.1       Debian package management system
ii  emacs21 [emacsen]         21.4a+1-5.7    The GNU Emacs editor
ii  emacs22-gtk [emacsen]     22.3+1-1       The GNU Emacs editor (with GTK use
ii  emacs23 [emacsen]         23.1+1-4       The GNU Emacs editor (with GTK+ us
ii  install-info              4.13a.dfsg.1-5 Manage installed documentation in 
ii  xemacs21-mule [emacsen]   21.4.22-2      highly customizable text editor --

ii  dict                       1.11.1+dfsg-3 dictionary client
ii  perl-doc                   5.10.1-2      Perl documentation
ii  wget                       1.12-1        retrieves files from the web
Please look at the bug report below concerning lcomp.el.
The bug email correspondence will be visible at:

Galbraith, Debian Developer          <psg@debian.org>
                                 http://people.debian.org/~psg
GPG key 1024/D2A913A1 - 97CE 866F F579 96EE  6E68 8170 35FF 799E

> but I believe it shouldn't rely on the return value from ad-do-it, but
> instead look at ad-return-value.

> I think it only goes wrong if there's other `around' defadvice on the
> func in question.

For a solitary advice the ad-do-it is a direct call
> to the function, but when that's not so I think you get the return from
> other advice, and that advice isn't obliged to return anything in
> particular.

> Perhaps something like the following, untested, also a simplification
>
> and make corresponding changes to the ad-enable-advice /

Email to your used email addres bounced and I found this one on the
net.
I guess you will have to update that in lcomp.el as well!

I updated original lcomp.el as same as your fix in
few years ago.
I will merge original version and emacs-goodies version.

And I will
upload it to EmacsWiki.
When I updated it, should I report that to this mail address?

I wrote new version of lcomp.el.
You can get released version from EmacsWiki:
Or development version from bitbucket(now same as release version):

Now lcomp.el is became a global-minor-mode, and keybinding enhancement
is not installed by default.
lcomp-activate-advices is still worked, but it is obsolete.
I hate it when this happens...

I fogot to close to bug with 31.5 last
February.

> but I believe it shouldn't rely on the return value from ad-do-it, but
> instead look at ad-return-value.

title: RFP: lp-solve-xli-lindo -- A xli_LINDO plugin for lp-solve
